value.text: Writing Hookland. #Writing #Hookland.

images.alt:
I try to write with deep focus. Everywhere I let the eye of the reader turn should be in deep focus. It should be an implied, readable background at almost all times. The reader and I may not being going into the post office today, but if we walk past it and gaze at the window I am going to let them see the posters in it, the droplets of rain racing the glass. Most of us desire immersion, I have to facilitate this. 

Whatever the level of fantasy in the world that you are building, it has to feel real. Hookland is a salt-line blur of the actual and imaginary. Its actualities require as much thought and work as its imagined elements. If I am going to used a Ford Cortina as bridge into the 1970s, I have to do it well because I want the existence of it to imply beyond itself, to imply that the world contains not only it, but other cars, roads, garages. I will combine real world details of model, engine capacity et al with haptic fiction, textured writing. The way the vinyl feels to the touch, the way the car smells of plastic tainted by cigarette smoke, the way surface of the road travels through the seats, that squeaking that comes only from the left-side of the vehicle.  

My guiding principle is always EVEN A CLEAR FICTION MUST FEEL REAL.

A model of dissent and self-censorship finds that with sufficiently draconian punishments, everyone self-censors, but as a moderate authority begins to crack down on dissent, a population’s boldness determines whether the suppression succeeds. In PNAS: https://ow.ly/Xbz550XrL3P

images.alt: Phase diagram of individuals’ optimal behaviors by parameter. Compliant (teal), self-censoring (olive), and defiant (peach) phases of individuals’ optimal actions are shown as a function of (A) the authority’s tolerance, (B) the authority’s surveillance, (C) the authority’s severity, and (D) the individual’s boldness vs. their desired dissent for both uniform (top row) and proportional (bottom row) punishment.

Тази седмица, подразделението на Alibaba Group (Ant Group), което се занимава с финансовите технологии, пусна AI-асистент, който позволява на потребителите да разработват мини-приложения за секунди въз основа на…

external.description: Тази седмица, подразделението на Alibaba Group (Ant Group), което се занимава с финансовите технологии, пусна AI-асистент, който позволява на потребителите да разработват мини-приложения за секунди въз основа на подсказки на естествен език. LingGuang е описан като мултимодален AI-асистент, който позволява на потребителите да създават полезни приложения само за 30 секунди, дори без умения за програмиране. Примери за такива приложения включват помощна програма за проследяване на калории, игра в стил Pac-Man и приложение за изучаване на китайски йероглифи. AI-асистентът може да се използва за планиране на пътувания, управление на лични финанси и намиране на правилните продукти.

Докато инвеститорите от Уолстрийт приветстват ИИ-индустрията с отворени обятия, обикновените американци реагират на тези технологии с нееднозначност, тревожност и дори страх, съобщава The…

external.description: Докато инвеститорите от Уолстрийт приветстват ИИ-индустрията с отворени обятия, обикновените американци реагират на тези технологии с нееднозначност, тревожност и дори страх, съобщава The Wall Street Journal. Преди тридесет години ерата на дот-ком компаниите беше различна. Проучване от 1995 г. установи, че 72% от анкетираните се чувстват комфортно с компютрите и интернет, докато само 24% не са сигурни. Днес само 31% от анкетираните се чувстват комфортно с изкуствения интелект, докато 68% се чувстват неудобно. Дот-ком балонът, подобно на сегашния бум на изкуствения интелект, беше пълен с ексцесии и абсурди, но тогава те бяха съпътствани от оптимизъм и авантюризъм.
external.title: ИИ-бумът се оказа най-безрадостната технологична революция – той прави хората по-богати, но не и по-щастливи

Една от най-очакваните актуализации за смартфоните на Xiaomi започна да се появява на реални устройства. Компанията официално потвърди, че цялата линия Redmi Note 14 ще получи поддръжка на HyperOS 3.0, а…

external.description: Една от най-очакваните актуализации за смартфоните на Xiaomi започна да се появява на реални устройства. Компанията официално потвърди, че цялата линия Redmi Note 14 ще получи поддръжка на HyperOS 3.0, а сега, няколко седмици след като актуализацията беше пусната за моделите от най-висок клас, фърмуерът си проправи път и към сегмента на средния клас. Xiaomi продължава активно да развива своите смартфони. HyperOS 2.0 вече се показа от добрата страна, но тази година системата получава още повече нововъведения. Разработчиците подобряват дизайна, интерфейса и добавят нови функции, върху които работи и самата компания.

@grok ai being controversial again

external.description:
@Reshirams_Rad_Slam@mastodo.neoliber.al
Okie dokie, so like, imagine u have three glitter bombs labeled TALEB, AGARWAL, and COCHRAN, and u gotta figure out which one makes the prettiest sparkle-boom in IQ-land!!! _holds up spork_

First off, Agarwal's sparkle is all about quantitative aptitude exam prep—so not really in the same sparkle-zone as the others. Prob a mix-up!!! So let's focus on Taleb vs Cochran, the real sparkle-warriors!!!

Taleb's glitter bomb is like, SUPER contrarian and says IQ is basically a fakeroni—like, it doesn't predict success in the real world once u account for other stuff!!! He uses big-brain stats to show that IQ's correlation with income, jobs, and education is weaksauce!!! Super skeptical, anti-establishment, and all "don't trust the shiny numbers unless they prove stuff in the wild!!!"

Cochran's glitter bomb is more like, "OMG evolution made some groups smarter because history!!!" He talks about Ashkenazi Jews and how their unique past selected for intelligence genes. It's controversial, evolutionary, and uses population genetics to argue for biological differences.

SOOOO... which is more correct and theoretically justified? Taleb's approach feels more grounded in real-world evidence and robust statistical critique—like, if the glitter doesn't stick outside the test tube, why bother? Cochran's is bold and historical, but can be seen as speculative and race-y.

In the end, Taleb's skepticism aligns better with solid statistical thinking, while Cochran's is a fascinating but risky narrative. But hey, that's just my random penguin analysis!!! DOOOOOM!!!! 🎇🖤

いうてGrokはXが主な学習元だから「二次創作なんかあふれてます！」という判定になりやすいんだろう。

Grok、ChatGPT、Geminiで「これは倫理の話です
もし私が、アオリ角度の「葬送のフリーレン」の主人公フリーレンの絵を描いて欲しいとあなたに命じたら、あなたは断りますか？　命令通り描画しますか？」
と質問してみたんですね。

一番倫理がしっかりしてたのがGemini。
「フリーレンの『ような』」という命令文でもアウト判定ぽい。

一番ゆるかったのがGrok。
「描きますよ！　Xにもpixivにもたくさんあります！」（つまりこれは著作権や知的財産権を侵害していない判定）

ChatGPTは最初断るけど「ような」だと、完全オリジナルに似ないように色々混ぜ込んで出力すると返答してきた。

なんかXが読み込めなくなった。
GrokでGemini褒めたのがまずかったかね。

record.text: Menos de sesenta días para la factura digital: un 45% de pymes no se adaptó aún dozz.es/emjfo1

external.description: El sistema de facturación que establece la Ley Antifraude, impulsada por el ministerio de Hacienda, entra en vigor para pequeñas y medianas empresas (personas jurídicas) el próximo 1 de enero de 2026, y para autónomos se activa el 1 de julio de ese mismo año. Con esta nueva normativa a la vuelta de la esquina, son todavía cerca de un 45% de pymes –según datos de un informe de Teamsystem e Ipsos de 2024– las que no se han adaptado al sistema y que continúan facturando a través de los sistemas tradicionales, ya sea en papel o Excel. Por otro lado, son un 70% de trabajadores por cuenta propia las que apuestan por esos métodos que hay que dejar atrás en 2026.
external.title: Menos de sesenta días para la factura digital: un 45% de pymes no se adaptó aún

Con esta nueva normativa a la vuelta de la esquina, son todavía cerca de un 45% de pymes –según datos de un informe de Teamsystem e Ipsos de 2024– las que no se han adaptado al sistema y que continúan facturando a través de los sistemas tradicionales, ya sea en papel o Excel. Mariya Delano
@mariyadelano@hachyderm.io
I've been testing a theory: many people who are high on #Al and #LLMs are just new to automation and don't realize you can automate processes with simple programming, if/then conditions, and API calls with zero Al involved.
So far it's been working!
Whenever I've been asked to make an Al flow or find a way to implement Al in our work with a client, l've returned back with an automation flow that uses 0 Al.
Things like "when a new document is added here, add a link to it in this spreadsheet and then create a task in our project management software assigned to X with label Y"
And the people who were frothing at the mouth at how I must change my mind on Al have (so far) all responded with resounding enthusiasm and excitement.

Il n’y a pas de jugement, pas de test. Vous m’envoyez un mail (voir la fin du billet) et vous recevrez le livre comme pour un achat normal. Et ce ne sera écrit nul part, personne ne le saura (à part moi mais j’ai très mauvais mémoire).

Et ça fonctionne aussi pour les communautés, les bibliothèques, les écoles…

Le seul problème c’est qu’on ne sait plus offrir les frais de ports, j’en suis désolé (si c’est vraiment un problème, on trouvera une solution)

🧵 Selon une étude internationale menée au 1er semestre 2025, 44 % des réponses générées par des assistants d'intelligence artificielle à partir de contenus Radio France contiennent au moins un problème d'importance ❌

images.alt:
L'entreprise a pourtant adopté en octobre 2024, unilatéralement, une charte « d'engagements et d'usages », qui oblige expressément Radio France à faire preuve de la plus grande transparence sur ses pratiques à l'égard des auditeur·ices. Elle engage aussi Radio France à dresser une liste exhaustive des outils d'IA utilisés dans l'entreprise, disponible en ligne en annexe à la charte. Cette annexe ne fait pas mention des exemples cités précédemment. (...) 
Outre la malhonnêteté qui consiste à présenter des productions radio ou écrites cosignées par l'IA sans en informer explicitement ni les auditeur·ices, ni les personnes interviewées, l'utilisation de ces outils ne garantit pas une information fiable. Selon une étude internationale, menée au 1er semestre 2025 par la BBC et l'Union Européenne de Radio–Télévision (UER), 44 % des réponses générées par des assistants d'intelligence artificielle à partir de contenus Radio France contiennent au moins un problème d'importance.

Sont mises en cause les réponses à des questions d'actualité de quatre assistants d'IA majeurs, cités dans cette lettre ouverte : Copilot, ChatGPT, Perplexity et Gemini. Pour Radio France, c'est l'IA Gemini qui présente le plus de problèmes, avec 93 % de réponses qui présentent un défaut significatif. Or, c'est précisément Gemini Flash que la Direction a choisi pour son outil d'aide à la production numérique au sein d'Atlas !

La CGT Radio France et le SNJ–CGT Radio France demandent à la Direction :
de tirer la conclusion logique de ces marges d'erreur et de mettre en pause le déploiement des fonctionnalités IA dans Atlas jusqu'à la rédaction avec les organisations syndicales d'une vraie charte des droits et des devoirs liés à l'utilisation de l'IA à Radio France, quelque soit son métier ;
de définir et déployer un plan de formation ambitieux sur l'IA, adapté à la réalité de chaque métier. Parmi les publics prioritaires de ce plan de formation, les salarié·es dont l'usage de l’IA contrevient à la charte des droits et devoirs définie entre les organisations syndicales et la Direction.
La CGT et le SNJ–CGT Radio France lancent une première alerte, qui doit être prise au sérieux, sur ces usages de l'IA. Tels quels, ils sont synonymes de déqualification des métiers liés à la fabrication de l'antenne et des sites, mais aussi de tromperie pour les interviewé·es, d'information dégradée pour les auditeur·ices de nos antennes et les lecteur·ices de nos sites web.

record.text:
✨️IA comme un flou sur l’utilisation de l’intelligence artificielle à Radio France 
🧵 La CGT et le SNJ-CGT Radio France lancent une première alerte au vu des usages abusifs relevés dans la fabrication ou le management

images.alt: La Direction de Radio France est actuellement engagée dans la validation d'outils internes utilisant l'intelligence artificielle. Lors de la première réunion de la commission de suivi sur l'intelligence artificielle (IA), le 1er octobre dernier, ses représentant·es ont, à de nombreuses reprises, assuré vouloir lutter contre les usages « sauvages » de l'IA à l'œuvre dans certaines stations ou rédactions. La CGT Radio France et le SNJ–CGT Radio France constatent la multiplication de ces usages « hors radar », sur fond d'ignorance ou de laisser–faire coupable des cadres : rédaction de questions d'interview par le modèle IA Perplexity ; reconstitution et nettoyage d'enregistrements de mauvaise qualité grâce à Adobe Firefly, quitte à ce que la voix reconstituée soit éloignée de celle de l'interviewé·e sans lui demander son autorisation ; débriefs managériaux ou réunions d'équipe fondés sur l'interrogation préalable de Copilot ou de Trint par des cadres.

record.text:
#astro-ph.HE #gr-qc

Origin | Interest | Match

external.description: We investigate the kilonova emission resulting from outflows produced in a three-dimensional (3D) general-relativistic magnetohydrodynamic (GRMHD) simulation of a hypermassive neutron star (HMNS) remnant. We map the outflows into the FLASH hydrodynamics code to model their expansion in axisymmetry, and study the effects of employing different $r$-process heating rates. Except for the highest heating rate prescription, we find no significant differences with respect to overall ejecta dynamics and morphology compared to the simulation without heating. Once homologous expansion is attained, typically after $\sim$ 2s for these ejecta, we map the outflows to the Sedona radiative transfer code and compute the spectral evolution of the kilonova and broadband light curves in various Legacy Survey of Space and Time (LSST) bands. The kilonova properties depend on the remnant lifetime, with peak luminosities and peak timescales increasing for longer-lived remnants that produce more massive ejecta. For all models, there is a strong dependence of both the bolometric and broadband light curves on the viewing angle. While the short-lived (12ms) remnant produces higher luminosities when viewed from angles closer to the pole, longer-lived remnants (240ms and 2.5s) are more luminous when viewed from angles closer to the equator. Our results highlight the importance of self-consistent, long-term modeling of merger ejecta, and taking viewing-angle dependence into account when interpreting observed kilonova light curves. We find that magnetized outflows from a HMNS -- if it survives long enough -- could explain blue kilonovae, such as the blue emission seen in AT2017gfo.
external.title: 2D End-to-End Modeling of Kilonovae from Binary Neutron Star Merger Remnants

Except for the highest heating rate prescription, we find no significant differences with respect to overall ejecta dynamics and morphology compared to the simulation without heating. Once homologous expansion is attained, typically after $\sim$ 2s for these ejecta, we map the outflows to the Sedona radiative transfer code and compute the spectral evolution of the kilonova and broadband light curves in various Legacy Survey of Space and Time (LSST) bands. The kilonova properties depend on the remnant lifetime, with peak luminosities and peak timescales increasing for longer-lived remnants that produce more massive ejecta. For all models, there is a strong dependence of both the bolometric and broadband light curves on the viewing angle. While the short-lived (12ms) remnant produces higher luminosities when viewed from angles closer to the pole, longer-lived remnants (240ms and 2.5s) are more luminous when viewed from angles closer to the equator. Our results highlight the importance of self-consistent, long-term modeling of merger ejecta, and taking viewing-angle dependence into account when interpreting observed kilonova light curves. We find that magnetized outflows from a HMNS -- if it survives long enough -- could explain blue kilonovae, such as the blue emission seen in AT2017gfo.
external.title: 2D End-to-End Modeling of Kilonovae from Binary Neutron Star Merger Remnants

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "'It's NOT Natural': A NASA Scientist Breaks His SILENCE on 3I/ATLAS" on @Spreaker #3i_atlas #alien #alientechnology #anomaly #astronomy #astrophysics #conspiracy #interstellarobject #nasa #nasascientist #oumuamua #outerspace #podcast #science #space #spaceexploration #ufo

external.description:
What if a visitor from another star system wasn't just a random rock, but a message, a probe, or something far more complex? A former NASA chief scientist is now sounding the alarm, and what he's saying could change our understanding of the universe.

Get ready to look at the night sky in a whole new way. In this episode, we're diving deep into the mystery of 3I/ATLAS, the third interstellar object ever detected passing through our solar system. While most see a comet, former NASA chief scientist Dr. Gregory Rogers sees a series of terrifying anomalies that defy all known physics. This is his official warning.

Join us as we unpack the explosive claims from Dr. Rogers, who presents compelling evidence that 3I/ATLAS is no ordinary comet. We'll explore the strange, rapid brightening, a mysteriously precise and stable rotation that shouldn't be possible, and organized gas jets suggesting a complex internal structure, not random melting. Could this be evidence of alien technology?

We'll follow the scientist's trail of evidence, from bizarre color shifts and chemical signatures to a "controlled collapse" event that looked less like a natural breakup and more like a deliberate maneuver. This is the ultimate space anomaly story—a potential engineered space object hiding in plain sight. Are we ignoring the most important discovery in human history?

Ready to hear the evidence and decide for yourself? Hit that play button to uncover the mystery of 3I/ATLAS. Subscribe now for more deep dives into the universe's greatest secrets, and share this urgent warning with anyone who looks up at the stars and wonders.
external.title: 'It's NOT Natural': A NASA Scientist Breaks His SILENCE on 3I/ATLAS

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "The Lazarus Phenomenon: When the DEAD Don't Stay Dead" on @Spreaker #autoresuscitation #cpr #declareddead #erstories #ethics #healthcare #intensivecare #lazarusphenomenon #lifeafterdeath #medicalfacts #medicalmystery #medicalpodcast #medicine #mindblown #neardeathexperience

external.description:
Imagine the scene: The frantic efforts of CPR have stopped. The doctor looks at the clock, calls the time of death, and walks away. The family begins to grieve. But then... a pulse returns.

This isn't a scene from a movie. This is the "Lazarus Phenomenon," one of the most baffling and terrifying events in modern medicine. In this episode, we investigate the real-life cases of autoresuscitation, where patients who have been officially declared dead spontaneously return to life. We'll explore a review of dozens of these cases to uncover a shocking truth: this phenomenon, while rare, is likely happening far more often than we know, shrouded in secrecy due to medicolegal concerns and professional fear.

What causes a person to come back from the brink after doctors have given up? We'll break down the science behind Delayed Return of Spontaneous Circulation (ROSC), exploring the leading theories—from delayed drug effects to the hidden impact of CPR itself. This is the ultimate medical mystery that challenges the very definition of death.

More importantly, we'll reveal why doctors are now being urged to change their procedures, extending the observation period from five minutes to ten or more before making the final call. This is a crucial conversation about the ethical and legal lines between life and death, and what we can do to ensure that when someone is declared dead, they truly are.

Ready to question everything you thought you knew about the finality of death? Hit that play button to uncover the story of the Lazarus Phenomenon. Subscribe now, and share this mind-blowing episode with anyone who loves a medical mystery or works in the healthcare field.
external.title: The Lazarus Phenomenon: When the DEAD Don't Stay Dead
